body: Try compiling the development `bleed` branch.  #12484 fixed an issue that stopped (images of) the original discs from being detected.
How do you mount your .iso and is it really mounted? Try clicking the CD symbol, open the README file and then start OpenRA to check again.

sory for answer for late, so my cd's are allready mounted, I can open any file if i want.

so I try to compil openra from github it crash on start...

Is it beceause i don't install it in root system ?
The mod browser was removed recently, so the crash should be gone now anyway. You can also try using the latest release, which includes #12484 and  #12219.

This could also be a filesystem case sensitivity problem. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13760#issuecomment-319601742 Mounting ISOs vs. putting in real CDs and even Linux distribution or file manager specific settings might complicate this further.
@PowaBanga: Can you please try again using the latest release?  Is this still a problem?

ok, I am on archlinux now, so, if i am correct, openra is already updated on this OS

I tried with VF CDs from here https://www.abandonware-france.org/ltf_abandon/ltf_jeu.php?id=974&fic=liens , and English version from here : http://www.moddb.com/games/cc-red-alert/downloads/cc-red-alert-full-game-allied-iso

I mounted them with fuseiso, in ~/RA1 & ~/RA2 folders.

Finaly OpenRA didn't dectect my CDs :/
Does it work if you mount the isos as `/media/<youruser>/cdrom/`?
yes it work, in this case :)
